      • getNonEmptyInput

        public static java.lang.String getNonEmptyInput(java.lang.String prompt,
                                                java.util.Scanner sc,
                                                boolean printFirst)
        Prompts user continuously until a non empty input is given
        Parameters:
        prompt - the message that is used as prompt when asking for input
        sc - the scanner that takes in user's input
        printFirst - true if prompt needs to be printed first, otherwise false
        Returns:
        the user's input that is not empty

      • getNonEmptyInput

        public static java.lang.String getNonEmptyInput(java.lang.String prompt,
                                                java.util.Scanner sc)
        Prompts user continuously until a non empty input is given with prompt printed first
        Parameters:
        prompt - the message that is used as prompt when asking for input
        sc - the scanner that takes in user's input
        Returns:
        the user's input that is not empty

      • getCharFromInput

        public static char getCharFromInput(java.lang.String input,
                                    java.util.List<java.lang.Character> excusedChars)
        Gets the front character of the specified menu only if they have one character in it unless it is a specified excused characters e.g. T will be followed by ID for thread selection If invalid, 'I' for Invalid is returned
        Parameters:
        input - the input string inputted by the user
        excusedChar - the character excused to have more letters behind e.g. T
        Returns:
        the front character of a valid input, else 'I' for Invalid.

      • getCharFromInput

        public static char getCharFromInput(java.lang.String input)
        Gets the front character of the specified menu only if they have one character in it If invalid, 'I' for Invalid is returned
        Parameters:
        input - the input string inputted by the user
        Returns:
        the front character of a valid input, else 'I' for Invalid.

      • promptForNum

        public static int promptForNum(java.util.Scanner sc,
                               java.lang.String prompt)
        Prompts user continuously until a number has been inputted.
        Parameters:
        sc - the scanner that takes in user's input
        prompt - the prompt displayed to user
        Returns:
        the number inputted

      • isNumeric

        public static boolean isNumeric(java.lang.String str)
        Takes in string and checks if it is Numeric
        Parameters:
        str - string to check
        Returns:
        true if numeric, false otherwise
